comment: 'ʔinti' is in fact the second person feminine form, the second person masculine form is 'ʔinta' (Erwin 1963:271).
'ʔinti' is in fact the second person feminine form, the second person masculine form is 'ʔinta' (Erwin 1963:271).
'-it͡ʃ ' is in fact the second person feminine form, the second person masculine form is '-ak ' (Erwin 1963:272).
